monogr.title: An Eastern Theology of Priesthood: A Study Based on the Rite of Presbyteral Ordination in the Chaldean and Syro-Malabar Church

biblStruct.note: The first section outlines the historical and liturgical setting for the eastern practice of ordination. The second and longer section discusses the theology of priesthood, with chapters on "The priesthood of Christ", "The Election of the Church and the Ecclesiastical Ministry", "The Grace and the Talents of Priesthood", and "Priestly Ministry: Functional Facts". With appendixes explaining terms and presenting documents, a bibliography and an index.
